name: INNCOM
overview:
INNCOM develops and markets integrated room automation systems to the global lodging industry. INNCOM is the acknowledged worldwide leader in this rapidly growing market. Since 1986, our systems have been installed in more than 500,000 hotel rooms. High-profile sites include St. Regis in New York, Grand Hotel Wien in Vienna, Raffles L’Ermitage in Beverly Hills, Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, Gaylord Opryland in Nashville, Alvear Palace in Buenos Aires, Maksoud Plaza in Sao Paulo, Ã‡iragan Palace in Istanbul, Atlantis Paradise Island in the Bahamas and the Taj Palace in New Delhi. Historically, sales represent a strong blend of domestic and international business.

Markets: INNCOM’s core business is guestroom control systems for the global lodging market. The Company’s technology can be directly applied in several related markets, including universities, military housing facilities, and health care facilities.

Product & Technology: INNCOM develops and markets a broad range of intelligent devices. These are combined in various ways to provide integrated room automation systems for DDC energy management, guestroom status, on-line electronic lock control, guest (end-user) interfaces, and operating enhancements for housekeeping, security, minibar restocking and other hotel staff groups. INNCOM systems provide highly effective remote control of virtually every electric appliance found in hotel rooms, including lights, HVAC, TV, telephones, and drapes.

acquisition.source_description: INNCOM of Connecticut acquired by Honeywell
